    1. Become a Twitter User
Vintage Social Media

Subject to change as the term progresses. (slides will become available online mid July 2015)

Lecture Topic Readings
1 Big Data Social Science
  • Relationship between social media, big data, data science, natural language processing
  • Social science research on finance, politics, health, human behavivor, etc.
  • Diurnal and Seasonal Mood Vary with Work, Sleep, and Daylength Across Diverse Cultures by Golder and Macy (Science 2011)
  • Big Data, Machine Learning, and the Social Sciences by Hanna Wallach (2014)
  • What is Twitter, a Social Network or a News Media? by Kwak, Lee, Park and Moon (WWW 2010)
  • Political Polarization on Twitter by Conover, Francisco, Flammini, Flammini (ICWSM 2011)
2 Twitter and Twitter API Tutorial
  • Brief history of Twitter
  • Key features of Twitter
  • Hands-on instructions on obtaining Twitter data via APIs
  • Twitter API Tutorial by the instructor Wei Xu
  • Google's Python class (for people with a little bit of programming experience who want to learn Python) by Nick Parlante
  • Intro to NLP in Python by Bird, Klein, Loper
3 Natural Language Processing for Social Media (part 1)
  • Main research areas and publication venues of NLP
  • Domain/Genre Difference
  • Language identification
  • Classification method: Na√Øve Bayes + feature selection (Information Gain)
  • How Noisy Social Media Text, How Diffrnt Social Media Sources? by Baldwin, Cook, Lui, MacKinlay, Wang (IJCNLP 2013)
  • langid.py: An Off-the-shelf Language Identification Tool by Lui, Baldwin (ACL 2012)
4 Natural Language Processing for Social Media (part 2)
  • Challenges in processing social media text
  • NLP Pipeline
  • Tokenization
  • Text Normalization
  • What to Do about Bad Language on the Internet? by Jacob Eisenstein (NAACL 2013)
  • Lexical Normalisation of Short Text Messages : Makn Sens a #twitter by Han, Baldwin (ACL 2011)
5 Natural Language Processing for Social Media (part 3)
  • Part-of-speech tagging
  • Chunking
  • Named entity recognition
  • Part-of-Speech Tagging for Twitter : Annotation, Features, and Experiments by Gimpel et al. (ACL 2011)
  • Named Entity Recognition in Tweets : An Experimental Study by Ritter, Clark, Mausam, Etzioni (EMNLP 2011)
  • A Dependency Parser for Tweets by Kong et al. (EMNLP 2014)
  • Open Domain Event Extraction from Twitter by Ritter, Mausam, Etzioni (KDD 2012)
6 Natural Language Processing for Social Media (part 4)
  • Obtaining large-scale paraphrases from Twitter
  • Sarcasm and sentiment analysis
  • Extracting Lexically Divergent Paraphrases from Twitter by Xu, Ritter, Callison-Burch, Dolan, Ji (TACL 2014)
  • Cooooooooooooooollllllllllllll!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Using Word Lengthening to Detect Sentiment in Microblogs by Brody, Diakopoulos (EMNLP 2011)
  • Semi-Supervised Recognition of Sarcastic Sentences in Twitter and Amazon by Davidov, Tsur, Rappoport (CoNLL 2010)
7 A Case Study - multi-tweet summarization and the PageRank algorithm
  • PageRank algorithm
  • Graph visualization
  • Hands-on instructions on building an automatic summarizer
  • PageRank Wikipedia Page
  • A Preliminary Study of Tweet Summarization using Information Extraction by Xu, Grishman, Meyers, Ritter (LASM 2013)
  • Python-Graph (a library for working with graphs in Python)
Last updated July 14, 2015.
Feel free to reuse any of the contents of this course or this web page. The source code is on github .
